summary: The Judicial Reorganization Act of 2025 proposes to amend Title 28 of the United States Code. It focuses primarily on reorganizing the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals by splitting it into two circuits (Ninth and Twelfth), adding new judgeships to the newly formed circuits, and defining the assignment of judges based on their current duty stations.  The bill also addresses the handling of pending cases and provides administrative guidelines for the transition, including an effective date and funding authorization.
